page.title: 04Government-Broughton/Holt
page.content: As in most rural districts this area has a three-tier system of local government ie Parish Council, District Council and County Council. The two parishes in this area are in the West Wilts. District. The Parish Councils have little real power and act mainly as an advisory body on local affairs to District and County Councils. A local rate is levied and used for cemetary maintenance, street lighting and miscellaneous items. Broughton Gifford is different from many parish councils as it is also the Lord of the Manor and owns the Common in the north of the village. The administration of the Common and the adjudication of squabbles, between villagers and people with common rights, usually consumes much of the time at Parish Council meetings.
